data.event: First settled in 1877, Gladstone's original name was Minnewasca.
Gladstone was first settled in 1859 when the Hamilton Corporation of Fayette, MI began using it as a shipping point for selling and transporting of their iron ore.

event.title: 1987). Gladstone Centennial History. Gladstone Centennial Book Community. Pp 12–

data.event: [Gladstone Centennial Book Community (1987). Gladstone Centennial History. Gladstone Centennial Book Community. Pp 12–47. ASIN B0010K5HFW] The town was originally named Minnewasca by the Soo Line Railroad, the Ojibwa name meaning "white water."
